greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of nonprime prime indices of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
example: 24 has prime indices {1,1,1,2}, of which {1,1,1} are nonprime, so a(24) = 3.
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); sum(k=1, #f~, if(!isprime(primepi(f[k,1])), f[k,2], 0)); \\ _Daniel Suteu_, Jan 14 2020
xref: The number of prime prime indices is given by A257994.
Primes of prime index are A006450.
Primes of nonprime index are A007821.
Products of primes of prime index are A076610.
Products of primes of nonprime index are A320628.
Numbers whose prime indices are not all prime are A330945.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jan 13 2020
